qas.question: What is the main service of an inn, now also attainable in motels, hotels and lodges?
What is the main provision that pubs offer?
What are customers seeking when they visit restaurants or taverns?
What is a noted hotel brand throughout North America?
In the United States, what are operators of lodgings sometimes called?

context: The original services of an inn are now also available at other establishments, such as hotels, lodges, and motels, which focus more on <a0_0>lodging<a0_0/> customers than on other services, although they usually provide meals; pubs, which are primarily <a1_0>alcohol<a1_0/>-serving establishments; and restaurants and taverns, which serve <a2_0>food and drink<a2_0/>. In North America, the lodging aspect of the word "inn" lives on in hotel brand names like <a3_0>Holiday Inn<a3_0/>, and in some state laws that refer to lodging operators as <a4_0>innkeepers<a4_0/>.
